column2: FLORIDA DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign tells drivers:
column4: turning right on red is forbidden.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column8: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.

column2: 2. Drivers may not cross ______________ unless turning left when it is safe to do so.
column8: broken yellow lines

column2: 3. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column10: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 4. When passing a truck, drivers should:
column4: decrease their speed if passing the truck on a downgrade.
column8: pull in front of the truck before they can see the cab.
column10: let the truck driver know they are passing by blinking their headlights.

column2: 5. People who drive after drinking risk:
column8: injuries and fatalities.

column2: 6. At 40 MPH, the average driver’s reaction time accounts for __ feet travelled.
7. Ramp signals:
column4: control the speed of vehicles entering a freeway.
column6: are not considered traffic control devices.
column8: control the weight of trucks entering a freeway.
column10: control the rate of vehicles entering a freeway.

column2: 8. This is:
column8: a merging traffic sign.

column2: 9. Which of the following is NOT a defensive driving tip:
column4: It is better to drive off the road than skid off when avoiding a crash.
column6: Hitting a car moving in the same direction as you are is better than hitting a car head-on.
column8: Hitting a post is better than hitting a bush.
column10: It is better to swerve right instead of toward oncoming traffic to prevent a crash.

column2: 10. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column6: there is a low place in the road.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 11. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the right lane must go straight.

column2: 12. When you are driving on a multi-lane road, if another vehicle moves into your lane right in front of you, cutting you off, you should:
column4: Brake only if necessary to avoid a crash, and follow the other vehicle closely for a while.
column6: Honk your horn and brake firmly, to quickly drop back from the other vehicle.
column8: Stay calm. Slow down if necessary to avoid a crash, and gently drop back to a safe following distance.

column2: 13. Drinking alcohol while taking other drugs could cause:
column6: the effects of alcohol to be multiplied.
column8: death.

column2: 14. When a public transit bus traveling in the same direction has signaled and is re-entering the traffic flow, drivers should:
column4: yield the right-of-way to the bus.
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: pass the bus on the right.
column10: pass the bus on the left.

column2: 15. What does ‘overdriving your headlights’ mean?
column4: Driving so slow that your headlights go into standby mode.
column6: Driving over a bridge with your headlights on.
column8: Driving so fast that you cannot stop within the range of the headlights.
column10: Driving so fast that you could break your headlights.

column2: 16. Overdriving your headlights is dangerous because:
column4: you can't see upcoming road hazards.
column6: your stopping distance is greater than the effective illumination of your headlights.
column8: your stopping distance is too short.

column2: 17. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column8: maximum speed

column2: 18. An ____ pavement marking may be painted on the paved approach to a railroad crossing:
column8: RXC

column2: 19. Florida law requires that motorists give cyclists a minimum of ______ feet of clearance and reduce their speed.
column8: fifteen

column2: 20. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column10: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 21. On a two-way roadway with a center lane, drivers from either direction can make ______ on the center lane.
column8: left turns

column2: 22. __________________ are required by law when changing lanes or overtaking a vehicle.
column8: Traffic signals

column2: 23. Under what conditions are drivers allowed to turn right on a red light?
column6: After yielding to pedestrians in crosswalks and to vehicles still in the intersection.
column8: At most intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 24. The length of a point suspension is 3 months for:
column8: 24 points within a 24-month period.

column2: 25. Which of the following is a penalty for a First DUI Conviction:
column8: Driving License termination

column2: 26. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 27. Which of the following is recommended for mature drivers?
column4: Stopping to rest every two hours on long trips.
column6: Installing small side mirrors to improve visibility.
column8: Not wearing safety belts while fatigued.

column2: 28. An emergency vehicle is approaching with flashing lights on. You must:
column4: pull over immediately and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed.
column6: slow down and stop at the next intersection.
column8: stop and block the intersection if necessary.
column10: increase your speed and stop at the next parking area.

column2: 29. Any driver under 21 with a breath or blood alcohol level of __ or higher is required to attend a substance abuse course.
30. Which of the following are allowed on expressways?
column4: Motor scooters with more than 150 cubic centimeter displacement
column8: Bicycles

column2: 31. You are driving on a roadway with multiple lanes of travel in the same direction, and are approaching an emergency vehicle parked along the roadway. You must:
column4: Leave the lane closest to the emergency as soon as it is safe to do so, or slow down to a speed of 20 MPH below the posted speed limit.
column8: If you are in the lane closest to the emergency vehicle, immediately come to a complete stop and ask if any help is needed.

column2: 32. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column10: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.

column2: 33. Car insurance is important because:
column6: you can drive faster if you have the proper insurance coverage.
column8: it protects yourself and others.
column10: it may be required by law.

column2: 34. This sign means:
column8: You may make a U-turn.

column2: 35. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.

column2: 36. Turning motorists must _____________ at intersections and driveways:
column6: block the crosswalk when stopped at a red light
column8: stop for pedestrians
column10: make a turn that causes pedestrians to stop

column2: 37. While his/her vehicle is disabled on the highway or shoulder, a driver should use:
column8: left and right turn signals together.

column2: 38. Alcohol tolerance:
column8: is lower when you drink whisky.

column2: 39. When the gas pedal is jammed, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: keep their eyes on the road.
column8: pump the brake pedal hard and fast.

column2: 40. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column6: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column8: pass the car on the left.
column10: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.

column2: 41. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column6: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column8: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column10: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.

column2: 42. Leaving the scene of a crash involving injuries commits a felony of the ____ degree.
column8: fourth

column2: 43. A diamond-shaped marking on the left lane shows that:
column4: the lane is reserved for car-pool vehicles.
column6: the lane is reserved for state-owned vehicles.
column8: the lane is reserved for trucks and heavy vehicles.

column2: 44. What is the speed limit for cars in a residential area?
column8: 20 MPH

column2: 45. At most intersections, after stopping, drivers may __________ on red if the way is clear.
column8: turn right

column2: 46. If a law enforcement officer suspects your vehicle equipment is not properly maintained, the officer:
column4: may force you to read the 'Perfect Car' handbook.
column6: may stop your vehicle at any time for a vehicle inspection.
column8: may suspend your driver license.

column2: 47. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 48. When the foot brake is pressed, which light must come on?
column8: One red brakelight.
column10: Two high-beam headlights, visible from 1,000 feet.

column2: 49. The pedestrian countdown period _____ at the beginning of the DON’T START or flashing hand phase and _____ with a zero and a DON’T WALK or solid red hand.
column8: ends; ends

column2: 50. If you are the driver or owner of a vehicle which is in a crash that is your fault, and you do not have insurance to comply with the Financial Responsibility Law, you:
column6: can be fined up to $1,000 or jailed up to 60 days.
column8: may be required to pay for the damages before your driving privilege is reinstated.
column10: must purchase a policy with a minimum coverage of $50,000 within 60 days.
